newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian budget to go to full Chamber on Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Italian budget to go to full Chamber on Thursday.

text.p: The Italian budget will go before the full Chamber of Deputies (lower house) on Thursday and not Wednesday as originally planned.
Parliamentary party leaders decided late Monday to put back the opening budget session because the lower house faces a heavy schedule of non-budget related affairs on Wednesday.
The Chamber has until November 14 to ratify the 1997 financial package which was narrowly approved by the lower house budget commission late Monday night.
The budget is designed to cut 62.5 trillion lire off next year's deficit, preparing state accounts for the launch of the planned single European currency in 1999.
After the package has been approved by the lower house, it goes to the Senate (upper house) for ratification. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
